title: Calories in Vegetable Soup
meta_description: Discover calories in vegetable soup per cup, including carbs, protein, fat, sodium, and variations for different recipes.
assumptions: Homemade vegetable soup with carrots, celery, tomatoes, onions, potatoes; broth-based, no added oil or cream; ~240 ml serving.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, vegetables used, sodium content, and preparation method. Check labels for canned or store-bought versions.

quick_answer.text: One cup of vegetable soup typically contains about 72 kcal and 3 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil during cooking
Creamy version with 2 tbsp heavy cream

faqs.q: How many calories in one cup of vegetable soup?
faqs.a: About 72 kcal for a basic broth-based vegetable soup.

faqs.q: What are the carbs and fiber in vegetable soup?
faqs.a: Typically 12 g carbs and 3 g fiber per cup from vegetables.

faqs.q: Is vegetable soup high in sodium?
faqs.a: It can be; around 400 mg per cup, higher in canned varieties.

faqs.q: How does canned vegetable soup compare in calories?
faqs.a: Similar at 70-90 kcal per cup, but often higher sodium.
Yes, by using low-starch veggies; carbs can drop to under 10 g per cup.
